data.text: He that revengeth shall find vengeance from the Lord,
Forgive thy neighbor the hurt that he hath done unto thee,
One man beareth hatred against another,
He showeth no mercy to a man, which is like himself:
If he that is but flesh nourish hatred,
Remember thy end, and let thy enmity cease;
Remember the commandments, and bear no malice to thy neighbor:
Abstain from strife, and thou shalt diminish thy sins:
A sinful man disquieteth friends,
As the matter of the fire is, so it burneth:
A hasty contention kindleth a fire:
If thou blow the spark, it shall burn:
Curse the whisperer and double-tongued:
A backbiting tongue hath disquieted many,
A backbiting tongue hath cast out virtuous women,
Whoso hearkeneth unto it shall never find rest,
The stroke of the whip maketh marks in the flesh:
Many have fallen by the edge of the sword:
Well is he that is defended from it,
For the yoke thereof is a yoke of iron,
The death thereof is an evil death,
It shall not have rule over them that fear God,
Such as forsake the Lord shall fall into it;
Look that thou hedge thy possession about with thorns,
And weigh thy words in a balance,
Beware thou slide not by it,
